name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
actions_desc: The tyrannosaurus makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target. Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 33 (4d12 + 7) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target. Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.
description:
Tyrannosauruses were enormous predators, with large heads that measured 6 feet (1.8 meters) long with teeth that were 3 to 6 feet (0.91 to 1.8 meters) in length.[6] Despite their enormous size, they were known to be fast runners.[3][6] Tyrannosaurs were not greatly intelligent and their savage nature could occasionally lead them to doing self-destructive acts, such as swallowing the horned head of a triceratops whole.[6] Among those who knew of dinosaurs, tyrannosaurs were considered to be some of the most fearsome and dreadful of carnivorous dinosaurs.[6] Tyrannosaurs were a carnivorous species that hunted any creature they considered edible, and were terrors to all other creatures in their territory.[3][6] If prey was scarce, a tyrannosaurus could survive on carrion and smaller creatures.[3] Tyrannosaurs were primarily known to inhabit the jungles of Chult.[7] Beyond the Prime Material plane, some could be found in the Forbidden Plateau.[8] The fangs of these creatures were highly valued by collectors outside of Chult.[9] In the early-14th century DR, a tyrannosaur devoured the adventuring companions of Elijah Moonspeak.[7] During the Time of Troubles of 1358 DR, the deity Ubtao stalked the jungles of Chult in the form of a tyrannosaur and battled the snake god Sseth.[10] The deity Ubtao's avatar form was that of an enormous tyrannosaurus rex, over twice its normal size. And as dinosaurs, tyrannosaurs were believed to be among the Children of Ubtao.[10] Sauropods: Anchisaurus • Brachiosaurus • Brontosaurus • Camarasaurus • Cetiosaurus • Diplodocus • Mamenchisaurus • Massospondylus • Plateosaurus
Ornithopods: • Ankylosaurus • Camptosaurus • Dacentrurus • Hadrosaurus • Iguanodon • Kentrosaurus • Lambeosaurus • Monoclonius • Paleocinthus • Pentaceratops • Stegosaurus • Styracosaurus • Trachodon • Triceratops
Pterosaurids: Pteranodon • Pterosaurus • Quetzalcoatlus
Aquatic: Elasmosaurus • Mosasaurus • Nothosaurus • Plesiosaurus • Temnodontosaurus
caption: A tyrannosaurus rex, sometimes improperly called a fang titan drake, or as gnasher in the Living Jungle of Malatran Plateau, was a carnivorous species of dinosaur.
